ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot of grammar, vocabulary, and verb skills which built off of last term.
Learned more grammar and vocabulary in introductory Italian.
Significantly advanced my knowledge of the grammar of the Italian language as well as learning far more vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not much turnaround for exams, but even if you aren't doing well in the course, you will end up learning some Italian, which is pretty cool.

strength- the book is a great resource and the way the course is structured around it is conducive to learning. there could be more in-class teaching, though, rather than a complete reliance on learning concepts at home.

The course was a good balance of learning the grammar and vocabulary but also I enjoyed learning about more obscure aspects of the language in the asynchronous activities. 
Often the way the course worked was we completely exercises on our own and then we reviewed them in class and were taught the grammar. I think it would be more effective if we were taught the grammar and then did the exercises

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend. Everybody needs a language requirement, and the Italian department is very good.
Yes, Italian has been interesting, and obviously this is a requirement to continue in the language but I would recommend.
yes- this class is the next step to getting a greater knowledge of italian.
Yes its an enjoyable course. Classes are very interactive so I found myself making new friends in this class. And I found it very rewarding to expand my knowledge of the language.
